channel.title: This American Life
channel.description: This American Life is a weekly public radio show, heard by 2.2 million people on more than 500 stations. Another 2.5 million people download the weekly podcast. It is hosted by Ira Glass, produced in collaboration with Chicago Public Media, delivered to stations by PRX The Public Radio Exchange, and has won all of the major broadcasting awards.
channel.itunes:author: This American Life
channel.itunes:subtitle: This American Life is a weekly public radio show, heard by 2.2 million people on more than 500 stations. Another 2.5 million people download the weekly podcast.

item.title: 186: Prom
item.description: While the seniors danced at Prom Night 2001 in Hoisington, Kansas—a town of about 3,000—a tornado hit the town, destroying about a third of it. When they emerged from the dance, they discovered what had happened, and in the weeks that followed, they tried to explain to themselves why the tornado hit where it did. Plus other stories that happen on Prom Night.
item.itunes:author: This American Life
item.itunes:subtitle: While the seniors danced at Prom Night 2001 in Hoisington, Kansas—a town of about 3,000—a tornado hit the town.
item.itunes:summary: While the seniors danced at Prom Night 2001 in Hoisington, Kansas—a town of about 3,000—a tornado hit the town, destroying about a third of it. When they emerged from the dance, they discovered what had happened, and in the weeks that followed, they tried to explain to themselves why the tornado hit where it did. Plus other stories that happen on Prom Night.
item.dc:creator: This American Life

item.title: 702: One Last Thing Before I Go
item.description: Words can seem so puny and ineffective sometimes. On this show, we have stories in which ordinary people make last ditch efforts to get through to their loved ones, using a combination of small talk and not-so-small talk.
item.itunes:author: This American Life
item.itunes:subtitle: Ordinary people make last ditch efforts to get through to their loved ones.
item.itunes:summary: Words can seem so puny and ineffective sometimes. On this show, we have stories in which ordinary people make last ditch efforts to get through to their loved ones, using a combination of small talk and not-so-small talk.
item.dc:creator: This American Life

item.title: 701: Black Box
item.description: Desperate to know what happened to his family, a man obsessively decodes the only information about them he can get. That, and other stories of people looking into the void for answers.
item.itunes:author: This American Life
item.itunes:subtitle: Desperate to know what happened to his family, a man obsessively decodes the only information about them he can get.
item.itunes:summary: Desperate to know what happened to his family, a man obsessively decodes the only information about them he can get. That, and other stories of people looking into the void for answers.
item.dc:creator: This American Life

item.title: 700: Embiggening
item.description: Sometimes a sketch of a thing needs filling in for its true significance to be known.
item.itunes:author: This American Life
item.itunes:subtitle: Sometimes a sketch of a thing needs filling in for its true significance to be known.
item.itunes:summary: Sometimes a sketch of a thing needs filling in for its true significance to be known.
item.dc:creator: This American Life

item.title: 699: Fiasco!
item.description: Stories of when things go wrong. Really wrong. When you leave the normal realm of human error, fumble, mishap, and mistake and enter the territory of really huge breakdowns. Fiascos. Things go so awry that normal social order collapses.
item.itunes:author: This American Life
item.itunes:subtitle: Stories of when things go wrong. Really wrong.
item.itunes:summary: Stories of when things go wrong. Really wrong. When you leave the normal realm of human error, fumble, mishap, and mistake and enter the territory of really huge breakdowns. Fiascos. Things go so awry that normal social order collapses.
item.dc:creator: This American Life

item.title: 698: The Test
item.description: The coronavirus has now fully arrived in the United States. This week, stories of people trying to rise to that challenge, in some pretty extreme situations.
item.itunes:author: This American Life
item.itunes:subtitle: Stories of people trying to rise to the challenge presented by coronavrius, in some pretty extreme situations.
item.itunes:summary: The coronavirus has now fully arrived in the United States. This week, stories of people trying to rise to that challenge, in some pretty extreme situations.
item.dc:creator: This American Life

item.title: 697: Alone Together
item.description: This week, as the staff creates the episode from their apartments and houses, with our host in quarantine, in this moment when everyone’s reaching out to the people they love, we put together a collection of family stories, with some timely stuff at the top.
item.itunes:author: This American Life
item.itunes:subtitle: In this moment when everyone’s reaching out to the people they love, we put together a collection of family stories.
item.itunes:summary: This week, as the staff creates the episode from their apartments and houses, with our host in quarantine, in this moment when everyone’s reaching out to the people they love, we put together a collection of family stories, with some timely stuff at the top.
item.dc:creator: This American Life

item.title: 696: Low Hum of Menace
item.description: Things do not seem fine at all, but it’s hard to say why.
item.itunes:author: This American Life
item.itunes:subtitle: Things do not seem fine at all, but it’s hard to say why.
item.itunes:summary: Things do not seem fine at all, but it’s hard to say why.
item.dc:creator: This American Life

item.title: 695: Everyone's a Critic
item.description: People squirming in a world where everything is rated and reviewed.
item.itunes:author: This American Life
item.itunes:subtitle: People squirming in a world where everything is rated and reviewed.
item.itunes:summary: People squirming in a world where everything is rated and reviewed.
item.dc:creator: This American Life

item.title: 694: Get Back to Where You Once Belonged
item.description: People looking everywhere to find a place—any place—where, for once, they don't have to be the odd man out.
item.itunes:author: This American Life
item.itunes:subtitle: People looking everywhere to find a place—any place—where, for once, they don't have to be the odd man out.
item.itunes:summary: People looking everywhere to find a place—any place—where, for once, they don't have to be the odd man out.
item.dc:creator: This American Life
